page.title: 12Sampford-Britain in Bloom
page.content: The village has been entering the {Britain in Bloom Competition}for fifteen years.Firstly in the Regional Section,for the South West. Last year a new section for{Small Villages}was begun and Sampford won.This enabled the village to take part this year, 1985,in the International competition 'Entente Floral'The winner of which will be announced in September,in Switzerland. We understand that many people from the village plan to be at the Prize giving. One of the Judges was quoted as having counted the number of flower containers scattered about the village as numbering 603.4 for every man,woman and child in the village.The success of the village in the competition has certainly engendered a feeling of community spirit,providing that one enjoys gardening,of course.
